result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn T Appel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Lewd, Lascivious Behavior-Exposure, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall have no direct or indirect contact with Linda B.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant shall provide DNA sample.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn T Appel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned).
Victim does not request to be present for hearings

Def appeared in person.  Atty Mark David Bensen for State.  Pretrial held with DA; Defendant continues to waive right to counsel.  Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding his right to an attorney and accepts waiver.  Resolution reached; State moves to dismiss and read in Ct. 1.  Guilty plea entered on Ct. 2.  Court finds def guilty on Ct. 2 and orders Ct. 1 dismissed and read in.  Statement by DA Bensen.  Court proceeds to sentencing.  Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights.
Def appeared in person.  Atty Mark David Bensen for State.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.
Bond receipted at Clerk of Courts Office; COC Rec#15R 023991 dated 12/8/15
